forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. North wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 51, with temperatures rising to around 53 overnight. South southeast wind 7 to 10 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
Downtown San Francisco finds itself caught between the sun’s fleeting warmth and a brooding sky, as the afternoon drapes itself in the bittersweet promise of a soft rain. The temperature, hovering around a modest 58 degrees, begins to settle into a cooler embrace, making the city seem almost wistful. As the clouds gather, they shield the vibrant colors of the landscape, casting a muted hue over the city’s iconic features, suggesting the presence of a subtle marine layer cloaking the Golden Gate Bridge in a soft white veil. Although the clarity may be compromised, the ethereal beauty of this scene evokes a sense of introspection, inviting you to pause and appreciate the tranquil rhythm of the impending change.

As night approaches, the atmosphere thickens with the certainty of rain, a gentle patter anticipated from 10 p.m. onwards, with brisk winds embarking on a dance between 7 to 10 mph, hinting at the drama to unfold. In anticipation of the cool evening, it would be wise to layer thoughtfully; a warm sweater paired with a light waterproof jacket will keep you comfortable against the chill. With the day slipping into evening, one might consider a leisurely stroll through the softly lit streets, enjoying the hints of holiday decorations that spark the spirit. Or perhaps, seek refuge in a cozy café, sipping a warm drink while watching droplets race down the window—simple pleasures that suit this day’s melancholic charm.
